snippet: In Kunar Province, a seven-hour attack stopped at 8 a.m., officials said, suggesting that the insurgents sought to limit civilian casualties to avoid alienating local residents.
abstract: Taliban makes a show of force across Kunar province in northeastern Afghanistan, attacking dozens of government installations late at night but causing relatively few deaths or injuries; restraint suggests insurgents seek to limit civilian casualties to avoid alienating local residents.

byline.contributor: An employee of The New York Times contributed reporting from Kunar Province, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: In Kunar Province, a seven-hour attack stopped at 8 a.m., officials said, suggesting that the insurgents sought to limit civilian casualties to avoid alienating local residents.

headline.main: Afghan Strike Shows Force and Restraint of Taliban
headline.print_headline: Afghan Strike Shows Force And Restraint Of Taliban
